Now Cicero says that the lands of these conquered states had been restored 3 but in Verres’ time not a single Leontine except one family occupied any land 111 the Ager Leontinus. The land was, Cicero says, let to eighty-four farmers (aratores), some Sicilians, and others Romans. (Lib. 3. c. 51,- and c. 18. 24. 41). Becker concludes from the words ‘ paternas arationes ’ (Lib. 3. c. 41), that the leases were transmissible by succession (vererblich) ; but I have some doubt whether he knew exactly what he meant when he wrote this.
